abstract: A visit by Toyota’s president to Washington has helped the company overcome “serious credibility problems,” the transportation secretary, Ray LaHood, said.
snippet: A visit by Toyota’s president to Washington has helped the company overcome “serious credibility problems,” the transportation secretary, Ray LaHood, said.
lead_paragraph: TOYOTA CITY, Japan — Toyota faced “very, very serious credibility problems” in the wake of its safety crisis, but changed its attitude toward American regulators after its president, Akio Toyoda, visited the United States, Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood said Monday.

headline.main: U.S. Sees a Change of Attitude at Toyota
headline.print_headline: U.S. Official Perceives Change of Attitude at Toyota

byline.original: By Hiroko Tabuchi and Micheline Maynard
